verses.text: And at that time shall Michael stand up, the great prince which standeth for the children of thy people: and there shall be a time of trouble, such as never was since there was a nation \add even\add* to that same time: and at that time thy people shall be delivered, every one that \add shall\add* be found written in the book.
And many of them that sleep in the dust of the earth shall awake, some to everlasting life, and some to shame \add and\add* everlasting contempt.
And they that be wise shall shine as the brightness of the firmament; and they that turn many to righteousness as the stars for ever and ever.
But thou, O Daniel, shut up the words, and seal the book, \add even\add* to the time of the end: many shall run to and fro, and knowledge shall be increased.
Then I Daniel looked, and behold, there stood other two, the one on this side of the bank of the river, and the other on that side of the bank of the river.
And \add one\add* said to the man clothed in linen, which \add was\add* upon the waters of the river, How long \add shall it be to\add* the end of \add these\add* wonders?

And I heard the man clothed in linen, which \add was\add* upon the waters of the river, when he held up his right hand and his left hand unto heaven, and sware by him that liveth for ever that \add it shall be\add* for a time, times, and a half; and when \add he\add* shall have accomplished to scatter the power of the holy people, all these \add things\add* shall be finished.
And I heard, but I understood not: then said I, O my lord, what \add shall be\add* the end of these \add things?\add*
And he said, Go thy way, Daniel: for the words \add are\add* closed up and sealed till the time of the end.
Many shall be purified, and made white, and tried; but the wicked shall do wickedly: and none of the wicked shall understand; but the wise shall understand.
And from the time \add that\add* the daily \add sacrifice\add* shall be taken away, and the abomination that maketh desolate set up, \add there shall be\add* a thousand two hundred and ninety days.
Blessed \add is\add* he that waiteth, and cometh to the thousand three hundred \add and\add* five and thirty days.
But go thou thy way till the end \add be:\add* for thou shalt rest, and stand in thy lot at the end of the days.
